title: Systems and center of mass - mass of third object

content.question: Three small, uniform objects, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, are arranged as shown with each object’s center of mass a distance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> from the origin. Objects <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> each have the same mass, <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>, and are at positions <math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>45</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> above and below the <math alttext="negative x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, respectively. The center of mass of the three-mass system is at the origin. Which of the following relationships describes Object <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>’s mass <math alttext="lowercase m sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="lowercase m sub C equals uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi></math>

<math alttext="uppercase M is less than lowercase m sub C, which is less than 2 uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></math>
<math alttext="lowercase m sub C equals 2 uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></math>
<math alttext="lowercase m sub C is greater than 2 uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></math>
